taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Greek bryon, moss, and for Elizabeth G. Knight Britton, 1858â€“1934, American botanist]

bio:treatment.discussion: Found on open, calcareous soil across the northern reaches of the flora area, Bryobrittonia closely resembles Encalypta in its habitat preferences and growth form. Fruiting specimens produce the large, brownish calyptra diagnostic of the family, but, perhaps associated with dioicy, sporophytes are rare. Bryobrittonia can be separated from Encalypta, the only other genus in the family, by bulging distal laminal cells and crenulate distal leaf margins.
